text: Ahmed Aboutaleb, Arabic: أحمد أبو طالب , (born August 29, 1961 in Beni Sidel) is a Dutch politician of Moroccan descent. He is a member of the Labour Party (PvdA) and former mayor of Rotterdam. Aboutaleb migrated to the Netherlands in 1976. He studied telecommunication and worked as a journalist and a civil servant. He was also director of Forum, an organisation aimed at multicultural issues. From 2004 to 2007 he was an alderman of Amsterdam and from 2007 to 2008 deputy minister for social affairs and employment in the Fourth Balkenende cabinet. From January 2009 to October 2024 he was mayor of Rotterdam. Ahmed Aboutaleb is a Muslim, and married with four children. == References == * Biography at Parlement.com == Other websites == * Website of Rotterdam Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Aldermen of the Netherlands Category:Deputy government ministers of the Netherlands Category:Dutch civil servants Category:Dutch columnists Category:Dutch Muslims Category:Dutch translators Category:Labour Party (Netherlands) politicians Category:Mayors of Rotterdam Category:Moroccan politicians Category:Naturalised citizens of the Netherlands Category:Politicians from Amsterdam
title: Ahmed Aboutaleb
